property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: U.S. service member accepting tea from a village elder

note.text: Hospitality is a tradition and an essential aspect of Afghan culture. For many, it is a matter of family pride and integrity to offer guests the best they have. You should accept your host's hospitality whenever possible.
In villages, if your counterparts know you're arriving, they may provide a meal. If your visit is unexpected, they will provide tea and snacks.
